basics.name: Roman Nicolai
basics.label: Student + Systems Support Assistant
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S. in Computer Science at the University of Hawaii. I also work for the Telecommunications and Social Informatics research program at the university.

skills.name: IT Experience
keywords: ELK Stack (Elasticsearch + Logstash + Kibana) installation & configuration

courses: ICS 355 - Security & Trust I - Resource Protections : A
ICS 425 - Computer Security and Ethics : A

work.company: Research Corporation of the University of Hawaiʻi (RCUH)
work.summary: My position as Systems Support Assistant at TASI was shifted to Student Assistant at RCUH.
highlights: Conducted software testing in VMware ESXi generated environments
Installed ElastAlert2 for the ELK Stack implementation

work.company: Telecom. and Social Informatics Research Program / Pacific Health Informatics Data Center (TASI-PHIDC), University of Hawaii at Mānoa
work.summary: This position involves providing staff with in-house technical support as well as research on technical solutions to meet the program's needs.
highlights: Conducted software testing in VMware ESXi generated environments
Installed the ELK Stack and configured WSUS for the organization
Gained further experience with scripting, networking, and log reporting
Managed large-scale educational Zoom meetings hosted by the organization (50+ people)

volunteer.summary: Cybersecurity Club at the University of Hawaii at Mānoa. Club activites include group learning over cybersecurity concepts, competing in CTFs, and networking with the local cyber community.
Assisted Green Party politician Keiko Bonk during her run for Hawaii House of Representatives, 20th district.
highlights: Protested against commercial aquarium fisheries on Hawaii's outer islands
Also did paid landscaping work, including: yardwork, re-painting, remodeling, basic carpentry

volunteer.summary: Selected to attend environmental scholarship in Bali Barat National Park. Community service and education with other students from around the globe.

awards.title: Naval Horizons STEM Challenge
awards.summary: Students are invited to watch videos highlighting the Navy's cutting edge science and technology topics and submit reports on the 'state of the art' of the topic as well as a futurist vision of the Navy in 2040. Selected submissions receive a stipend.

awards.title: Certificate in Information Security and Risk Management
awards.summary: Offered through: UHM/ICS Department. In compliance with Educational Standards. Established by the NIST/DHS/NSA CAE-CDE Program Office.

awards.title: Around the World victor
awards.summary: Successfully answered all review questions, made it around the circle of students, and won the class exercise.
